arm_group.description:
Electroacupuncture before and after surgery (40min, 60 min)with frequency 2 Hz, and Dens- disperse pulse.
Placebo electroacupuncture, in which the needles are secured (without penetrating the skin)and connected to the electrical device, which is not functional.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether electroacupuncture is a effective tool to
      the postoperative analgesia

clinical_study.brief_title: The Positive Analgesic Effect of Low Frequency Electroacupuncture

detailed_description.textblock:
The electroacupuncture is a known therapeutic modality with particular application to pain.
      In this study the investigators investigate the effect of electroacupuncture in condition of
      surgery, which is a particularly painful situation. The investigators will verify the
      postoperative analgesia, as patients will receive either electroacupuncture or placebo
      electroacupuncture.

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria:

          -  healthy male volunteers

          -  18-75 years old

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, hepatic, neurological disease

          -  psychiatric history

          -  use of opioids until the last month

          -  body mass index greater than 30

          -  treatment with beta-blockers

          -  aged over 75

          -  previous experience with acupuncture

          -  hypersensitivity to opioids

          -  patients being treated with monoamine oxidase inhibitors and selective serotonin
             reuptake inhibitors.

study_pop.textblock:
Patients in the Surgical Clinic with right or left inguinal hernia, residents of Thessaly,
        Greece.

intervention.description: Electrical stimulation device with frequency 2 Hz and scanning pulse Dens- disperse

clinical_study.official_title: The Positive Analgesic Effect of Low Frequency Electroacupuncture in Plastic Inguinal Hernia Repair With Mesh

other_outcome.description: The State- Trait Anxiety Inventory performed 30, 90 min, 10 hours and 24 hours after surgery
other_outcome.measure: Control of anxiety with the State- Trait Anxiety Inventory within 24 hours after surgery

primary_outcome.description: measurements of cortisol, corticotropin and prolactin performed before and after preoperative ( 0, 40 min) and postoperative electroacupuncture (30, 90 min, 10 hours).
primary_outcome.measure: changes in cortisol, corticotropin and prolactin compared with electroacupuncture and surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0, 40 min and within the first 10 hours after surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Monitoring of pain with the Visual Analogue Scale performed in 30, 90 min, 10 hours and 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.measure: Monitoring of pain with the Visual Analogue Scale within the first 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within the first 24 hours after surgery

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
